JobTitle: Cloud Solution Architect - Lead Architect Software defined Vehicle (SDV)
JobFullDesc: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Together we make a difference. To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture  Check out all of our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us Lead Architect – Software defined Vehicle (SDV)  We are looking for a Lead Architect SDV to drive high priority customer and eco system initiatives on Azure in collaboration with customers and Microsoft. This is a technical, customer facing role that is accountable for the end-to-end customer cloud, developer, and edge deployment experience. If you do not fulfill all the requirements as of today – don’t worry we help you to get up to speed while building on your experience and knowledge.  ResponsibilitiesAs part of our team, you will drive our customers success by owning the Azure technical customer engagement including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or Proofs of Concepts. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer facing roles and success in leading deep technical architecture (including vehicle and / or embedded experience) and application design discussions with customer decision makers to drive cloud deployment. Key responsibilities include:  Be the advocate to translate the customers and eco-systems business needs and transformational journey into Azure based cloud and edge solutions with the goal to drive long-term customer success.Drive change through guiding transformational development experiences across Vehicle, DevOps, and Cloud.   This will also include the deployment of customer workloads into Azure and increase the relevance of the platform by providing deployment guidance, supporting development of the customers’ cloud adoption model, and providing appropriate recommendations to overcome blockers, expanding this to the intelligent Edge in our eco-system with various partners.   Furthermore, you will be one of the key (technical) leaders of our Software-defined Vehicle Projects and eco-system, additionally you will be part of the worldwide technical core team to shape and build the overall strategy of the software-defined vehicle eco-system.   Establish deep relationships with key (business) decision makers, who drive long-term cloud adoption within their company and core business.  Identify, validate, and grow innovative solutions in next-gen high potential customer accounts, in partnership with the other teams, by driving solution architecture for both Microsoft and 3rd party solutions. QualificationsMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. Hardware and Software abstraction. (incl. relevant automotive standards like AutoSar) Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with strong communication skills. 12+ years' experience in architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications  (i.e., having an architectural sense for ensuring availability, reliability, etc.) Deep technical experience in one or more of the following areas: Software design or development, Application Design, Systems Operations / Management, Database architecture, Virtualization, IP Networking, Storage, IT Security, Linux(with a focus on in-vehicle adaption) 5+ years’ experience in oversight experience on major transformation projects and successful transitions to implementation support teams Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences Be a true team player who enjoys learning and share with others. Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners, and external communities. Prior work experience in a Consulting/Architecture position within a software and/or services company such as Amazon, VMware, Google, IBM, Accenture, T-Systems, Wipro, CSC, HP, Infosys, Dell, TCS, Rackspace, Automotive OEMs and /or Automotive T1 suppliers etc. desired Fluency in English required, fluency in German would be a plus. Approx. 10+ years of “been there” experience in the Automotive industry.
